name: dom_parsing
comment: This library contains extra APIs that aren't in the DOM, but are useful when interacting with the parse tree.

htmlSerializeEscape.name: htmlSerializeEscape
htmlSerializeEscape.comment:
Escapes html5lib/dom_parsing.htmlSerializeEscape.text for use in the HTML fragment serialization algorithm. In particular, as described in the specification:

  • Replace any occurrence of the & character by the string &.

  • Replace any occurrences of the U+00A0 NO-BREAK SPACE character by the string  .

  • If the algorithm was invoked in html5lib/dom_parsing.htmlSerializeEscape.attributeMode, replace any occurrences of the " character by the string ".

  • If the algorithm was not invoked in html5lib/dom_parsing.htmlSerializeEscape.attributeMode, replace any occurrences of the < character by the string <, and any occurrences of the > character by the string >.

htmlToCodeMarkup.name: htmlToCodeMarkup
htmlToCodeMarkup.comment: Converts the DOM tree into an HTML string with code markup suitable for displaying the HTML's source code with CSS colors for different parts of the markup. See also html5lib/dom_parsing.CodeMarkupVisitor.

isVoidElement.name: isVoidElement
isVoidElement.comment: Returns true if this tag name is a void element. This method is useful to a pretty printer, because void elements must not have an end tag. See also: http://dev.w3.org/html5/markup/syntax.html#void-elements.

class.name: CodeMarkupVisitor
class.preview: Converts the DOM tree into an HTML string with code markup suitable for displaying the HTML's source code with CSS colors for different parts of the markup. See also html5lib/dom_parsing.htmlToCodeMarkup.

class.name: TreeVisitor
class.preview: A simple tree visitor for the DOM nodes.

packageIntro:
html5lib in Pure Dart

This is a pure Dart html5 parser. It's a port of html5lib from Python. Since it's 100% Dart you can use it safely from a script or server side app.

Eventually the parse tree API will be compatible with dart:html, so the same code will work on the client and the server.

Installation

Add this to your pubspec.yaml (or create it):

dependencies:
  html5lib: any

Then run the Pub Package Manager (comes with the Dart SDK):

pub install

Usage

Parsing HTML is easy!

import 'package:html5lib/parser.dart' show parse;
import 'package:html5lib/dom.dart';

main() {
  var document = parse(
      '<body>Hello world! <a href="www.html5rocks.com">HTML5 rocks!');
  print(document.outerHtml);
}

You can pass a String or list of bytes to parse. There's also parseFragment for parsing a document fragment, and HtmlParser if you want more low level control.

Running Tests

# From Dart SVN checkout
./tools/build.py -m release
./tools/test.py -m release html5lib
./tools/test.py -m release -r drt html5lib
